answerText: heat capacity [or specific heat][10] In contrast with the aforementioned Einstein model of a solid, this other scientist names a model of heat capacity in which a solid is assumed to be a bunch of phonons in a box.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 6 | 2 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One attempt to explain this quantity assumed each atom in a lattice was a harmonic oscillator, and that all of the oscillators vibrated at the same frequency. [10] Name this quantity calculated by the Dulong-Petit law, which is equal to the heat required to raise the temperature of an object by one degree.
